00060 #ifndef NS_INADDRSZ
00061 #define NS_INADDRSZ     4
00062 #endif
00063 #ifndef NS_IN6ADDRSZ
00064 #define NS_IN6ADDRSZ    16
00065 #endif
00066 #ifndef NS_INT16SZ
00067 #define NS_INT16SZ      2
00068 #endif
00069 
00070 /*
00071  * WARNING: Don't even consider trying to compile this on a system where
00072  * sizeof(int) < 4.  sizeof(int) > 4 is fine; all the world's not a VAX.
00073  */
00074 
00075 #ifdef AF_INET
00076 static int      inet_pton4 __P((const char *src, u_char *dst));
00077 #endif
00078 #ifdef AF_INET6
00079 static int      inet_pton6 __P((const char *src, u_char *dst));
00080 #endif
00081 
00082 /* int
00083  * inet_pton(af, src, dst)
00084  *      convert from presentation format (which usually means ASCII printable)
00085  *      to network format (which is usually some kind of binary format).
00086  * return:
00087  *      1 if the address was valid for the specified address family
00088  *      0 if the address wasn't valid (`dst' is untouched in this case)
00089  *      -1 if some other error occurred (`dst' is untouched in this case, too)
00090  * author:
00091  *      Paul Vixie, 1996.
00092  */
00093 int
00094 inet_pton(af, src, dst)
00095         int af;
00096         const char *src;
00097         void *dst;
00098 {
00099         switch (af) {
00100 #ifdef AF_INET
00101         case AF_INET:
00102                 return (inet_pton4(src, dst));
00103 #endif
00104 #ifdef AF_INET6
00105         case AF_INET6:
00106                 return (inet_pton6(src, dst));
00107 #endif
00108         default:
00109                 errno = 47; // EAFNOSUPPORT
00110                 return (-1);
00111         }
00112         /* NOTREACHED */
00113 }
00114 
00115 #ifdef AF_INET
00116 /* int
00117  * inet_pton4(src, dst)
00118  *      like inet_aton() but without all the hexadecimal and shorthand.
00119  * return:
00120  *      1 if `src' is a valid dotted quad, else 0.
00121  * notice:
00122  *      does not touch `dst' unless it's returning 1.
00123  * author:
00124  *      Paul Vixie, 1996.
00125  */
00126 static int
00127 inet_pton4(src, dst)
00128         const char *src;
00129         u_char *dst;
00130 {
00131         static const char digits[] = "0123456789";
00132         int saw_digit, octets, ch;
00133         u_char tmp[NS_INADDRSZ], *tp;
00134 
00135         saw_digit = 0;
00136         octets = 0;
00137         *(tp = tmp) = 0;
00138         while ((ch = *src++) != '\0') {
00139                 const char *pch;
00140 
00141                 if ((pch = strchr(digits, ch)) != NULL) {
00142                         size_t new = *tp * 10 + (pch - digits);
00143 
00144                         if (new > 255)
00145                                 return (0);
00146                         *tp = (u_char) new;
00147                         if (! saw_digit) {
00148                                 if (++octets > 4)
00149                                         return (0);
00150                                 saw_digit = 1;
00151                         }
00152                 } else if (ch == '.' && saw_digit) {
00153                         if (octets == 4)
00154                                 return (0);
00155                         *++tp = 0;
00156                         saw_digit = 0;
00157                 } else
00158                         return (0);
00159         }
00160         if (octets < 4)
00161                 return (0);
00162         memcpy(dst, tmp, NS_INADDRSZ);
00163         return (1);
00164 }
00165 #endif
00166 
00167 #ifdef AF_INET6
00168 /* int
00169  * inet_pton6(src, dst)
00170  *      convert presentation level address to network order binary form.
00171  * return:
00172  *      1 if `src' is a valid [RFC1884 2.2] address, else 0.
00173  * notice:
00174  *      (1) does not touch `dst' unless it's returning 1.
00175  *      (2) :: in a full address is silently ignored.
00176  * credit:
00177  *      inspired by Mark Andrews.
00178  * author:
00179  *      Paul Vixie, 1996.
00180  */
00181 static int
00182 inet_pton6(src, dst)
00183         const char *src;
00184         u_char *dst;
00185 {
00186         static const char xdigits_l[] = "0123456789abcdef",
00187                           xdigits_u[] = "0123456789ABCDEF";
00188         u_char tmp[NS_IN6ADDRSZ], *tp, *endp, *colonp;
00189         const char *xdigits, *curtok;
00190         int ch, saw_xdigit;
00191         u_int val;
00192 
00193         memset((tp = tmp), '\0', NS_IN6ADDRSZ);
00194         endp = tp + NS_IN6ADDRSZ;
00195         colonp = NULL;
00196         /* Leading :: requires some special handling. */
00197         if (*src == ':')
00198                 if (*++src != ':')
00199                         return (0);
00200         curtok = src;
00201         saw_xdigit = 0;
00202         val = 0;
00203         while ((ch = *src++) != '\0') {
00204                 const char *pch;
00205 
00206                 if ((pch = strchr((xdigits = xdigits_l), ch)) == NULL)
00207                         pch = strchr((xdigits = xdigits_u), ch);
00208                 if (pch != NULL) {
00209                         val <<= 4;
00210                         val |= (pch - xdigits);
00211                         if (val > 0xffff)
00212                                 return (0);
00213                         saw_xdigit = 1;
00214                         continue;
00215                 }
00216                 if (ch == ':') {
00217                         curtok = src;
00218                         if (!saw_xdigit) {
00219                                 if (colonp)
00220                                         return (0);
00221                                 colonp = tp;
00222                                 continue;
00223                         } else if (*src == '\0') {
00224                                 return (0);
00225                         }
00226                         if (tp + NS_INT16SZ > endp)
00227                                 return (0);
00228                         *tp++ = (u_char) (val >> 8) & 0xff;
00229                         *tp++ = (u_char) val & 0xff;
00230                         saw_xdigit = 0;
00231                         val = 0;
00232                         continue;
00233                 }
00234                 if (ch == '.' && ((tp + NS_INADDRSZ) <= endp) &&
00235                     inet_pton4(curtok, tp) > 0) {
00236                         tp += NS_INADDRSZ;
00237                         saw_xdigit = 0;
00238                         break;  /* '\0' was seen by inet_pton4(). */
00239                 }
00240                 return (0);
00241         }
00242         if (saw_xdigit) {
00243                 if (tp + NS_INT16SZ > endp)
00244                         return (0);
00245                 *tp++ = (u_char) (val >> 8) & 0xff;
00246                 *tp++ = (u_char) val & 0xff;
00247         }
00248         if (colonp != NULL) {
00249                 /*
00250                  * Since some memmove()'s erroneously fail to handle
00251                  * overlapping regions, we'll do the shift by hand.
00252                  */
00253                 const int n = (int) (tp - colonp);
00254                 int i;
00255 
00256                 if (tp == endp)
00257                         return (0);
00258                 for (i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
00259                         endp[- i] = colonp[n - i];
00260                         colonp[n - i] = 0;
00261                 }
00262                 tp = endp;
00263         }
00264         if (tp != endp)
00265                 return (0);
00266         memcpy(dst, tmp, NS_IN6ADDRSZ);
00267         return (1);
00268 }
00269 #endif
